did.abstract: This collection contains an unpublished typescript of "American Labor History" written by Edwin Smith. Edwin Smith was an American labor leader was one of the first three members of the National Labor Relations Board appointed by Franklin Delano Roosevelt. Smith's manuscript for "American Labor History," attempts to document the history of American labor from the colonial period up to the start of the Cold War in the 1950s. The manuscript is incomplete however, and only contains Chapters I through VII, ending in the 1820s. The collection also contains several biographical sketches of Smith including obituaries following his death in 1976.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Edwin S. Smith (1891-1976) served on the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) during the New Deal, as one of its original members, was a member and president of Friends of the Soviet Union, served as the personnel director of Filene's department store in Boston, and was Commissioner of Labor and Industries in Massachusetts. He also worked for the Oil Workers International Union of the CIO, and the Teachers' Division of the United Public Workers of America. When he appeared before the House Committee on Un-American Activities in 1956 he refused to answer questions about alleged Communist affiliation.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Diana Madell sent a gift of her father's manuscript and biographical information; the date of this donation is unknown. The accession number associated with this gift is 1950.002.

Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which she holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Diana Madell.
